thread.title: Marende set to announce ODM return and bid for Nairobi seat - Nairobi News
thread.title_full: Marende set to announce ODM return and bid for Nairobi seat - Nairobi News

title: Marende set to announce ODM return and bid for Nairobi seat - Nairobi News
text:
Marende set to announce ODM return and bid for Nairobi seat Posted on Feb 7, 2017 2183 Views Cord leader Raila Odinga (centre) accompanied by former Speaker Kenneth Marende (left) and Luhya Elders Forum Secretariat head Peter Ludaava when he visited ailing former Minister Joseph Otiende on February 06, 2017 at a Kisumu hospital. PHOTO | ONDARI OGEGA By PATRICK LANG’AT and JUSTUS OCHIENG 
Former National Assembly Speaker Kenneth Marende is on Tuesday expected to announce his return to ODM and his interest in the Nairobi governor’s seat. 
Mr Marende on Monday held a meeting with party leader Raila Odinga at his Bondo home before accompanying him to Kisumu to visit ailing former Kenyatta-era minister Joseph Otiende at Avenue Hospital. 
The former Emuhaya MP was in 2008 elected to Parliament on an ODM ticket, which went on to support his election as Speaker in the House. 
“My stand is solid and I am set to make an announcement tomorrow (Tuesday) on my next move,” he said on Monday. 
But Kiminini MP Chris Wamalwa dismissed him, calling him a Jubilee project. 
“He (Marende) cannot just come and want a ticket. He might be a Jubilee project sent to split our votes to let a Jubilee candidate win. I caution our people not to be used by Jubilee this way,” said Dr Wamalwa. 
“Discussions are ongoing, but so far Dr Kidero is our formidable candidate,” he said. 
Cord agreed not to field any other candidate. Latest Stories
